actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

official_title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to allow an individual who has attained age 55 a deduction for amounts paid for insurance to be used to pay real property taxes on the principal residence of the individual after the individual has attained age 65.

summary.text: Amends the Internal Revenue Code to allow, for taxpayers at least 55 years old, a deduction for the premiums for principal residence real property tax insurance. Allows the deduction whether or not the taxpayer itemizes other deductions.

titles.title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to allow an individual who has attained age 55 a deduction for amounts paid for insurance to be used to pay real property taxes on the principal residence of the individual after the individual has attained age 65.
